EXISTING STRUCTURES
──────────────────────
### Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network at positions (0.0, 0.0), (5.0, 0.0), (2.5, 0.5) & (2.5, -0.5)
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace for Iron Smelting at (0.0, 0.0) paired with a Burner Inserter at (1.5, 0.5) and a Dedicated Output Chest at (0.5, 2.5)
• Stone Furnace for Copper Smelting at (5.0, 0.0) with a Burner Inserter at (3.5, 0.5)
• Common Input Chest – Wooden Chest at (2.5, 0.5)
• New Feeder Inserter – Feeder Inserter at (2.5, -0.5) with pickup at (2.5, -1.5) and drop at (2.5, 0.5)
• Transport Belt Connection linking the mining output to the feeder inserter

### Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup at (-15.0, -50.0)
Consists of:
• Burner Mining Drill at (-15.0, -50.0) with output drop at (-14.5, -48.5)
• Drill Inserter at (-13.5, -47.5)
• Sink Chest – Wooden Chest at (-11.5, -46.5)
• Sink Inserter – Burner Inserter at (-10.5, -46.5) with pickup at (-9.5, -46.5) and drop at (-11.5, -46.5)
• Transport Belt Connection linking the mining drill drop to the sink inserter pickup

### Automation Research Lab at (5.5, 5.5) with Updated Electrical Connection
Consists of:
• Lab at (5.5, 5.5) (status: NO_POWER; research on Automation in progress)
• Electricity Network comprising a mix of original and newly placed Small Electric Poles forming ElectricityGroup (now id=1281) aimed at connecting the Lab to power sources

### Water Supply System for Power Generation with Updated Steam Engine Placement
Consists of:
• Boiler at (8.0, 20.5) (status: FULL_OUTPUT after fuel insertion)
• Offshore Pump at (0.5, 30.5) (status: WORKING)
• Steam Engine repositioned to (12.5, 17.5) (status: NOT_CONNECTED with warnings “not connected to power network”, “no input liquid”, “no fluid present in connections”)
• An intended pipe connection from the Boiler to the Steam Engine remains unsuccessful

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Crafting Resource and Sub-ingredient Validation:
 – When initiating automation science pack production, verify that all upstream production chains (e.g. furnace smelting for iron plates leading to iron-gear-wheel production) are fully established.
  
• Pipe Connection and Alignment:
 – Ensure that the connection endpoints of pipes (such as from the Boiler to the Steam Engine) are aligned and unobstructed. If a pipe connection error occurs, review nearby entity placements and clear any blockages.

• Entity Repositioning and Manual Placement:
 – Before manually placing an entity, confirm that the player is within the maximum placement range; if an error indicates the target is too far, move closer.
 – Verify that the target tile is unoccupied since placement failures may stem from existing objects in the way.

• Entity Placement and API Usage Validation:
 – Consistently use standardized, lowercase prototype names and access entity position attributes correctly to avoid reference or TypeErrors.

NAMESPACE
─────────
• shift_entity_local(entity: Entity, offset: Tuple[float, float]) -> Entity  
 – Shifts the given entity’s position by the specified offset  
  • Success: Entity is repositioned correctly  
  • Failure: Prototype mismatches may occur if identifier strings are not standardized

• nearest_buildable(position: Position) -> BoundingBox  
 – Determines the nearest buildable area surrounding a given position for entity placement  
  • Success: Returns a valid bounding box for placement  
  • Failure: Misuse of property access can trigger errors

• place_entity_next_to(prototype: Prototype, reference_position: Position, direction: Direction, spacing: int) -> Optional[Entity]  
 – Attempts to place an entity adjacent to a reference position based on the specified direction and spacing  
  • Success: Returns the placed entity  
  • Failure: Returns an error if the target position is occupied or invalid

• place_entity(prototype: Prototype, position: Position, direction: Direction) -> Optional[Entity]  
 – Attempts to place an entity of the given prototype at a specified position and direction  
  • Success: Entity is placed when within allowed range and if the target tile is free  
  • Failure: Raises an error if the target position is too distant or obstructed

Important Variables:
• furnace_input_chest_pos (Position) – Holds the position of the furnace input chest  
• current_player_inventory (Inventory) – Tracks the current state of the player’s inventory  
• mining_drill_drop (Position) – Stores the mining drill’s output drop position  
• target_chest_position (Position) – Represents the position of the attempted transport belt connection target
